intro: Siphocampylus bracteatus, commonly known as the bracteate siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, and the stems are often hairy. Siphocampylus bracteatus is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
